Spatial variations in Earth properties in the upper mantle beneath Antarctica. Seismic shear wave velocity perturbations at depths of ( a) 100, ( b) 200 and ( c) 300 km beneath Antarctica derived from an adjoint inversion of teleseismic waveforms recorded by seismic stations south of 45°S (ref.
52 ). Colours indicate observed Voigt average velocity anomalies relative to global reference model STW105 (ref.
147 ). Regions of negative anomalies (slower than global average velocities) suggest higher temperatures and hence likely lower viscosities
